metadata.titel_preek: Easter Season: From Darkness to Revelation

kernfrasen: the dead must cross over the black waters
he arose from the kingdom of Death
opened unto us the gate of everlasting life
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: DEATH IS A JOURNEY TO A DARK REALM

kernfrasen: evidence that will hold up in the courts of the skeptics
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITH IS A LEGAL VERDICT BASED ON EVIDENCE

cognitieve_implicaties: Death is an active agent that captures the living
theologische_implicaties: Humanity is powerless against the 'grip' of sin/death without external rescue
ethische_implicaties: Acceptance of human limitation and the need for a Savior
onbedoelde_consequenties: Death might be seen as an equal power to God (Dualism)

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the dead metaphor of 'death's grip' by adding the sensory detail of 'cold,' linking it to the literal burial of a loved one.

mapping_structuur.doel_element: A god who serves human whims

cognitieve_implicaties: A 'safe' god is a useless, man-made construct
theologische_implicaties: God's transcendence is essential to His divinity
ethische_implicaties: Believers must submit to God's will rather than trying to control Him
onbedoelde_consequenties: God may be perceived as indifferent or dangerous rather than loving

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: A sharp, contemporary disruption of the 'God is a friend' schema.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher uses the overarching container metaphor of 'Night/Darkness' to unify the three sections. The transition from the 'Night of Death' (John 20) to the 'Night of Doubt' (Thomas) to the 'Whirlwind' (Job) maintains a consistent theme of human limitation versus Divine revelation.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The preacher asks us to see God in the wounds of Jesus but also as the 'Who' behind the tornado that killed children.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: If God is the victim (wounds), He is vulnerable; if God is the author of the tornado, He is the aggressor.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher redefines 'dust' from a sign of curse to a sign of humble peace, blending the 'Creation' schema with the 'Resurrection' schema.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the conventional 'Light vs Dark' metaphor and grounds it in the physical reality of a cemetery at night.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early, while it was still dark.

risicos.beschrijving: The use of the River Styx and Greek mythology might confuse the biblical 'Sheol' with pagan concepts.
risicos.voorbeeld: the dead must cross over the black waters of the river Styx
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may adopt a non-biblical view of the afterlife.

sub_worlds: The Ruins of a Tornado-hit Church

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective in bridging the gap between ancient text and modern suffering.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By emphasizing the 'Whirlwind' and the 'Who' over the 'Why'.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Juxtaposing the 'man-made god' with the God of Job who answers with power, not explanations.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with the Easter season's movement from darkness to light.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the 'DARKNESS IS ABSENCE/DEATH' and 'LIGHT IS REVELATION/LIFE' domains. It successfully avoids the 'Economic' domain (transactional salvation), focusing instead on 'Relational' and 'Existential' mappings. The preacher effectively uses 'Verticality' (God in the whirlwind vs. man in the dust) to establish divine transcendence.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Focus on the physical 'nail prints' and 'wound in the side' as the preacher did with Thomas.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The rough texture of the scar tissue in Jesus' side.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: God as both the cause of the tornado and the sufferer of the wounds.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly use the 'Crucified God' metaphor to show that God's power is expressed through weakness, rather than leaving the two in unmediated tension.

entailment_checks.metafoor: GOD IS THE WHO (not the Why)
entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests God is arbitrary or beyond moral questioning.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'God is Father' metaphor to ensure the 'Who' is known as 'Love'.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To address the 'hideous skin disease' of Job as a mapping for the restoration of the whole person.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using sensory-rich source domains (darkness, dust, wounds) to communicate the most abstract theological truths of the Resurrection.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'poetic' use of darkness, CMT reveals that darkness is the cognitive frame through which the hearer processes the 'inconceivability' of the resurrection.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's experiential learning cycle, CMT shows that the 'experience' of the tornado is mapped onto the 'schema' of Thomas's doubt to create a new mental space for faith.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher is not just telling a story, but performing a 'Schema Disruption'—replacing the 'God as predictable' schema with 'God as Whirlwind'.

appendices.notities: The preacher relies heavily on the 'Container' schema (In the night, in the tomb, in the whirlwind) to define the boundaries of human experience.
